title: [BUG] Docker build context is still created even when skipping image build

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

- Client: 1.30.0


### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 20.04
- **Python version**: 3.9
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: N/A


### Describe the problem

When using a docker container environment the `mlflow run` command still creates the docker build context even though it isn't needed/used. If your project contains lots of local files such as a Python Virtual env or datasets it can take several minutes to build this context before even starting the run.

I believe: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/v1.30.0/mlflow/projects/docker.py#L79 should be moved to below line 89.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```sh
mlflow run . --skip-image-build
```
